docs.snippet: PORT TOWNSEND, Washington, July 21. -- The steamship George W. Elder, from Portland, went ashore two miles west of Point Wilson this morning during thick weather. The tide was well out and the vessel was nearly high and dry at low water. All her f...
docs.lead_paragraph: PORT TOWNSEND, Washington, July 21. -- The steamship George W. Elder, from Portland, went ashore two miles west of Point Wilson this morning during thick weather. The tide was well out and the vessel was nearly high and dry at low water. All her freight is being discharged on scows and taken ashore.

headline.main: A STEAMER AND A BARK ASHORE.; THE CARGO OF THE GEORGE W. ELDER IS BEING DISCHARGED.

docs.snippet: Off Hallett's Point, which is at Hell Gate, there was at about 6 o'clock last evening a collision between an iron steamship and a barge loaded with excursionists, which resulted in injuring a number of persons, but no one fatally, and in seriously...
docs.abstract: Eleanora's Collision with Excursion Barge W. Sands in Hell Gate
docs.lead_paragraph: Off Hallett's Point, which is at Hell Gate, there was at about 6 o'clock last evening a collision between an iron steamship and a barge loaded with excursionists, which resulted in injuring a number of persons, but no one fatally, and in seriously injuring both of the collided vessels. It was marvelous that the collision was not attended by a terrible sacrifice of human life.

headline.main: CRUSHED BY THE ELEANORA; MANY PERSONS ON AN EXCURSION BARGE INJURED. A SERIOUS COLLISION OFF HALLETT'S POINT -- HOW THE ACCIDENT HAPPENED -- THE LIST OF INJURED.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 18.--the steamers Leerdam, bound from Amsterdam to Buenos Ayres, with 400 passengers, and Gawquansia, bound from Calcutta to Hamburg, came in collision with each other in the North sea to-day, and both sank. All on board the two vesse...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 18.--the steamers Leerdam, bound from Amsterdam to Buenos Ayres, with 400 passengers, and Gawquansia, bound from Calcutta to Hamburg, came in collision with each other in the North sea to-day, and both sank. All on board the two vessels were saved, and were taken to Cuxhaven by the French steamer Emma.

headline.main: TWO STEAMSHIPS SUNK.; THE LEERDAM AND GAWQUANSIA IN COLLISION--NO LIVES LOST.

docs.snippet: The court of inquiry having in charge the investigation of the circumstances of the burning of the Wilson Line steamship Santiago at sea on Nov. 30 rendered its decision yesterday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The court of inquiry having in charge the investigation of the circumstances of the burning of the Wilson Line steamship Santiago at sea on Nov. 30 rendered its decision yesterday.

docs.snippet: The crew and passengers of the burned steamship Santiago, who were brought into port on Tuesday by the ship A.J. Fuller, were landed yesterday. Capt. Potter reported at the office of his agents, Sanderson  Son, and was warmly congratulated upon ha...
docs.lead_paragraph: The crew and passengers of the burned steamship Santiago, who were brought into port on Tuesday by the ship A.J. Fuller, were landed yesterday. Capt. Potter reported at the office of his agents, Sanderson Son, and was warmly congratulated upon having saved the lives of the passengers and crew.

headline.main: SAFE ON SHORE AGAIN.; THE CREW AND PASSENGERS OF THE STEAMER SANTIAGO LANDED.

docs.snippet: A collision occurred on Tuesday morning about eight miles off the Delaware Lightship between the Old Dominion steamship Cleopatra and the excursion steamer Crystal Wave. Both vessels were lost, but the crews were rescued by the Old Dominion steams...
docs.abstract: Crystal Wave's Collision with Cleopatra; Both Lost
docs.lead_paragraph: A collision occurred on Tuesday morning about eight miles off the Delaware Lightship between the Old Dominion steamship Cleopatra and the excursion steamer Crystal Wave. Both vessels were lost, but the crews were rescued by the Old Dominion steamship Kanawha, which landed them at this port yesterday.

headline.main: TWO STEAMERS SUNK.; AN EXTRAORDINARY COLLISION OFF THE DELAWARE LIGHTSHIP.

docs.snippet: QUEBEC, Aug. 8.--Capt. Bentley of the Allan Line steamer Assyrian arrived here to-day. He reports that on Monday last, as the Assyrian was sailing into the Strait of Belle Isle, she was signaled by the lighthouse keeper that the Dominion Line stea...
docs.lead_paragraph: QUEBEC, Aug. 8.--Capt. Bentley of the Allan Line steamer Assyrian arrived here to-day. He reports that on Monday last, as the Assyrian was sailing into the Strait of Belle Isle, she was signaled by the lighthouse keeper that the Dominion Line steamer Montreal was ashore.

docs.snippet: A curious naval parade was seen coming in by Sandy Hook yesterday forenoon. It was the result of a collision between the brig Kaluna and the schooner Joseph J. Pharo which had taken place in the fog of the night before fifteen miles southeast of S...
docs.abstract: Kaluna; Collision with Joseph J. Pharo
docs.lead_paragraph: A curious naval parade was seen coming in by Sandy Hook yesterday forenoon. It was the result of a collision between the brig Kaluna and the schooner Joseph J. Pharo which had taken place in the fog of the night before fifteen miles southeast of Sandy Hook. The procession was headed by New-Jersey Pilot Boat No. 6--the James Gordon Bennett.

headline.main: DANGER IN THE FOG.; TWO VESSELS DISABLED BY COLLISION RESCUED BY A PILOT BOAT.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 30.--A dispatch received from Deer Park late this afternoon has been read with a great deal of interest by the higher officers in the War Department....
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 30.--A dispatch received from Deer Park late this afternoon has been read with a great deal of interest by the higher officers in the War Department.

headline.main: ARMY MEN CONCILIATED; NO LONGER SUBJECT TO A CIVILIAN'S ORDERS. CHARGES AGAINST CHIEF HUSSEY GROWING OUT OF PENSION BUSINESS--ABANDONED ON AN ISLAND.
